intro: Riddellia, commonly known as the Australian sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves and flowers. The plants typically have small, narrow leaves and produce white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Riddellia species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued for their essential oils and have been used in traditional medicine and perfumery.
